New Records: Virat Kohli broke Sachin Tendulkar's record of 49 ODI hundreds with his 50th century
Key Match Events: India beat New Zealand by 70 runs to reach ICC Cricket World Cup final
Daryl Mitchell struck a hard-fought blistering century to lead New Zealand's fightback
Mohammed Shami took seven wickets to make up for dropping Kane Williamson's catch earlier on
Virat Kohli remained calm and measured in his innings from the beginning to bring up his half-century in 59 balls
Pre-Game Insights: India's captain Rohit Sharma said 'no score is enough' at the Wankhede
India's captain Rohit Sharma emphasized the importance of staying calm in the face of a billion baying fans
Post-Match Reflections: Mohammed Shami said his team were determined not to let the chance of winning a home World Cup slip out of their hands
India's captain Rohit Sharma said 'we knew we had to pull something out' in the face of a huge upset
Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi congratulated the team on reaching their fourth final
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai
India set a target of 398 in the tournament's first semifinal
New Zealand's reply struggled, with opener Devon Conway's World Cup also struggling
